info.author: Erik Max Francis
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License (GPL)
Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
A simple implementation of Lindenmayer systems (also called
    L-systems, substitution systems) is provided.  In basic form, a
    Lindenmayer system consists of a starting string of symbols from
    an alphabet, and has repeated transitions applied to it, specified
    by a list of transition search-and-replace rules.

    In addition to the standard formulation, two alternative
    implementations are included: sequential systems, in which at most
    one rule is applied; and tag systems, in which the transition only
    takes place at the beginning and end of the string.
info.keywords: Lindenmayer systems, Lindemeyer systems, L-systems, fractals, algorithmic beauty of plants, artificial life
info.name: LSystem
info.html_description:
A simple implementation of Lindenmayer systems (also called

L-systems, substitution systems) is provided. In basic form, a Lindenmayer system consists of a starting string of symbols from an alphabet, and has repeated transitions applied to it, specified by a list of transition search-and-replace rules.

In addition to the standard formulation, two alternative implementations are included: sequential systems, in which at most one rule is applied; and tag systems, in which the transition only takes place at the beginning and end of the string.
